column1: Thankfully our president is feeling much better and his prognosis is good! Praying for a speedy recovery for everyone who is having COVID-19 symptoms. 🙏🏼 https://t.co/2ScnvmfppC
I received a negative COVID-19 test tonight. Statement below. https://t.co/YkX6b3qd6L

House Democrats are clearly more concerned with what people CALL the coronavirus--than passing a bill that will help the American people & small businesses RECOVER from the coronavirus.   This stunning misplacement of priorities is having tragic consequences on real people.

We celebrate Labor Day this year recognizing that it's different & difficult for many Louisianians that may have lost their jobs due to COVID-19 or have lost their businesses from  Laura. Yet we are a hopeful resilient people & with faith & hard work we'll be even stronger. https://t.co/wy8IK3otCo

I spoke with @JonScottFNC tonight on @FoxNews about two critical issues: the coronavirus relief negotiations and  Louisiana’s path towards recovery after Hurricane Laura. (We have to keep this in the national news!) Watch our full conversation below.⬇️ https://t.co/WyS9uO2ImG

Earlier today I joined @NPRKelly on @NPR’s “All Thing Considered” to discuss the government’s response to COVID-19 and the historic storms headed straight for our district. This and more in my full interview below. ⬇️  https://t.co/WS31f7RlLL

Great news today! The @US_FDA has approved convalescent plasma as a treatment for COVID-19 patients. Thanks to the leadership of @realDonaldTrump & the work of his administration we are seeing expedited progress in the development of safe treatments & therapies for this disease. https://t.co/Fg36PZxooj

With so many communities competing for resources to battle COVID-19 I’m pleased we have been able to consistently secure such substantial aid for our district.  More beds in our hospitals and more supplies in the hands of our health care heroes translates to more lives saved.
Big news for our district today. $13.4 million in COVID-19 aid is headed to Ochsner @LSUHS for more ICU and hospital beds PPE ventilators and medical equipment.    https://t.co/ociM0ZVPuQ

Recognizing the seriousness of this virus & the danger it poses to high-risk individuals I began following the attending physician’s recommendation immediately. Should the attending physician recommend at any point that I take a COVID-19 test I will follow that guidance as well.

It is essential that the state reports COVID-19 numbers accurately and the discrepancy discovered in Red River Parish is raising serious questions. We will address this and many other issues on our Red River Parish telephone townhall this afternoon.  https://t.co/AKAM4H13dI

.@VP joined our Congressional Delegation @Coach_EdOrgeron @LouisianaGov Key members of the @whitehouse Coronavirus Task Force state legislatures & leaders of LA's higher education institutions to discuss the importance of reopening our schools this fall at every level. https://t.co/ZlTBHBJ5aC

I'm looking forward to meeting with @VP today in Baton Rouge about several issues related to COVID-19 including what the fall semester will bring for our schools and universities. Stay tuned here for updates.
Has the COVID-19 impacted your small business? The deadline to apply for a #PPP loan has officially been extended to August 8.   You can learn more about #PPP loans here: https://t.co/MMLZH6XIPa

Tune in now to watch the @JudiciaryGOP Subcommittee on Constitution Civil Rights and Civil Liberties conduct a hearing on mail-in ballots federalizing elections and in-person voting after the coronavirus pandemic. You can watch it here: https://t.co/UwHcTwCxGd

LA entering Phase 2 of reopening is welcome news for workers families businesses churches & every aspect of our society. We have a long way to go to reverse the damage COVID-19 has caused but we are a resilient people & we'll get through it together. https://t.co/lirTOTCq2r

🚨ATTENTION LOUISIANA FARMERS AND RANCHERS🚨  @USDA is now accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Our Louisiana farmers and ranchers will finally see much needed coronavirus relief.   Learn more here: https://t.co/FrHoxRQJ6X

Louisiana is grateful to @realDonaldTrump for focusing on REAL relief that encourages new job opportunities for those unemployed due to COVID-19. Rolling back onerous government regulations & cutting red tape are essential to get our economy booming again. https://t.co/p3li6UEY75

Fox News: “100 Rikers Island inmates arrested after being released over coronavirus: report.”  Yet @SpeakerPelosi wants to release more prisoners as part of her $3 trillion liberal wish list?  CRAZY.  https://t.co/XC67kGYzBj

Speaker Pelosi is using COVID-19 as an opportunity to push a liberal wishlist of policies that have NOTHING to do with the pandemic...at a cost to taxpayers of $3 TRILLION!   It's utterly shameful for Nancy Pelosi exploit a national crisis to try to push her radical agenda. https://t.co/hLlKvdEcMF

I am helping to lead an effort in Congress to protect small businesses and non-profits such as churches food banks and homeless shelters--which have made good-faith efforts to follow health and safety guidelines--against the looming threat of COVID-19 liability lawsuits.

As I explained to @FoxNews it's critical for non-profits such as food banks churches and homeless shelters--which have made good-faith efforts to follow health & safety guidelines--to be protected from the looming threat of COVID-19 liability lawsuits. https://t.co/cH3QlgxLCe

We can protect lives & livelihoods at the same time & we have to. LA has been hit hard by the coronavirus but certain communities were more impacted than others. That's why we are urging @LouisianaGov to implement a region-by-region approach to reopening our state’s economy. https://t.co/o39yPqw5YD

On this #NationalDayofPrayer let's pray for those affected by the coronavirus our health care providers & first responders our national & local officials and for our nation's recovery. Many people are suffering today but God is still sovereign. We are one nation under Him. https://t.co/oXij83TOua

America has issued 7 million tests for COVID-19 surpassing other nations by MILLIONS. Our nation has done a remarkable job increasing testing capacity thanks to @realDonaldTrump’s leadership and the work of the Coronavirus Taskforce. https://t.co/gYqsmdpcKq

Tune out the MSM. @realDonaldTrump's innovative response to COVID-19 has set a new precedent for presidential leadership during a national health crisis. History will show that cutting red tape private sector partnerships & letting states lead was key to overcoming this pandemic https://t.co/K35EZ2xbSB

🚨LIVE RADIO ALERT🚨  Tonight I’ll be joining @BreitbartNews Sunday with @joelpollak at 8:40 pm CT on @SiriusXMPatriot to discuss @RepublicanStudy’s blueprint for leading America through COVID-19 and ensuing economic recovery.   Be sure to tune in on channel 125!

$9.6 million from the @TheJusticeDept's COVID-19 emergency supplemental funds is going to good use by helping Louisiana state and local law enforcement respond to COVID-19 in our communities. Read more in the link below.  https://t.co/1VVZkHmWaO

Our state has been hit hard by COVID-19 the oil & gas crisis & even a series of violent storms--but Louisianians never give up & we always pull together.  The great people of Vernon Parish have shown once again why hope prevails here. #Louisianastrong https://t.co/3aOxTf4ZKJ

It's great to see that over $1.6 million in COVID-19 relief funds are headed to our public housing authorities - our most vulnerable communities. I thank @POTUS & @secbencarson for recognizing that need and helping to get the funds distributed quickly. https://t.co/dTINaFN2ad

Protecting the physical health of Americans doesn’t have to jeopardize the fiscal health of our nation. As @RepublicanStudy COVID-19 framework shows with the right mix of offsets and spending controls we can do both. #FlattenTheDebtCurve 📈📉  https://t.co/q55K2UOPth

LIVE INTERVIEW ALERT 🚨 I'll be joining @BloombergRadio with @kevcirilli at 4:15 p.m. CT to discuss at @RepublicanStudy Committee's 37-point blueprint to lead America through the COVID-19 pandemic and working our way to economic recovery. Be sure to tune in!

The COVID-19 pandemic has shown that innovative health care policies that put patients and doctors first can save lives. RSC's solutions build on those lessons by cutting red to tape to fast-track treatments and get our health care heroes the equipment they need to do their jobs. https://t.co/ZSskmnMhXf

Not only is this duplicative committee designed to help Pelosi’s political agenda it is also a COMPLETE waste of time and millions of precious taxpayer dollars.   @Jim_Jordan listed what our 8 committees are ALREADY doing to oversee our coronavirus response. See more below ⬇️ https://t.co/MDZXWqhEIu

Leave it to @SpeakerPelosi to turn a public health crisis into a political tool to attack @realDonaldTrump.   Now she has created yet another subcommittee for overseeing the coronavirus crisis when we ALREADY have 8 committees tasked with oversight on the response.

LET’S MAKE THIS CRYSTAL CLEAR: Individuals who quit their jobs just so they can collect COVID-19 unemployment benefits are COMMITTING A CRIME.  If u steal these precious taxpayer dollars during national emergency these will be the results under Louisiana law... https://t.co/5LHGmYorWY

I’m very pleased to see the @La_DOTD is receiving over $40 million to continue transit operations in rural parts of the state after being vastly impacted by COVID-19 due to stay-at-home orders.  Learn more about the @FTA_DOT grant here: https://t.co/OFP54Gmiwo

TOMORROW: Barksdale AFB will be honoring our amazing health care heroes with B-52 Flyovers.  What a great way to show our communities’ appreciation for the brave work they are doing on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic.  Learn more here: https://t.co/mHstcppU8U

ATTENTION: @fema is awarding over $6.5 million to the @LADeptHealth to continue our state's response to COVID-19. It’s encouraging to see the resources we’ve been fighting for in Washington are headed back to Louisiana. You can read my full statement here: https://t.co/4VbiC8i7fT

Great news from the @US_FDA! They have authorized the first at-home COVID-19 test. A huge thanks to @realDonaldTrump for cutting the red tape so that we can get these tests into the hands of the American people as soon as possible!  https://t.co/7J0jIXnz5N
Now because of stay-at-home orders and other efforts to prevent the spread of COVID-19 oil prices have crashed. It is more evident now than ever that we have got to get folks back to work. (2/3)

To ensure that China pays for its negligence I am cosponsoring a bill introduced by @SenTomCotton and @RepDanCrenshaw that will empower U.S. citizens to sue China in federal court to recover damages for death injury and economic harm caused by COVID-19. https://t.co/O2SD5Msjgf

China’s deceit has cost the United States dearly both in lives and livelihoods. More than three quarters of a million Americans have tested positive for COVID-19 and tragically nearly 40000 have lost their lives.

When faced with the initial outbreak of the novel coronavirus China's communist regime made the deliberate choice to spread misinformation suppress facts and silence whistleblowers – misleading not only its own citizens about the severity of the virus but the entire world.
The Chinese government’s deliberate coverup of COVID-19 is directly responsible for the most destructive and deadly global pandemic in our lifetime.

Before COVID-19 our economy was as strong as it had ever been – unemployment was at historic lows wages were up & businesses were thriving. I wholeheartedly believe that under @realDonaldTrump leadership our nation can reclaim that momentum & restore our booming economy. https://t.co/aVECKnRye7

I'm honored @realDonaldTrump has given me the opportunity to serve on the Task Force on Reopening the Economy. Before COVID-19 our economy was as strong as it had ever been. Under @POTUS' leadership I believe our nation can reclaim that momentum. https://t.co/RgtD5wg49j

It's an undisputed fact that the WHO parroted Chinese misinformation on COVID-19. For an org that so many nations depend upon to put its relationship with China above the health & safety of billions is unconscionable. @realDonaldTrump is right to cut funds https://t.co/KSCqOx8BbM

Louisiana has been severely impacted by COVID-19 so I am very encouraged to learn that Louisiana health care facilities will be receiving $474.8 million in the first round of expedited payments under the CARES Act. Learn more here: https://t.co/4iqN8ZZ7SG

(1/5) While there are positive signs that Louisiana may be turning a corner in the fight against coronavirus the past couple days have brought more news of tragedy & sorrow. Three great men who were servant leaders of their communities & beyond are among those who have been lost

Although I wish the telephone town hall occurred under better circumstances it was a pleasure to speak with you all this afternoon with @RepMarshall.   Louisianans are the strongest most resilient people in the world and we WILL get through the coronavirus pandemic---together. https://t.co/sJnam0B1Y1
Have questions about coronavirus? The @WhiteHouse @CDCgov and @fema put together a one-stop shop for you to get the answers you need here: https://t.co/3wQKvNEc6K

As we begin a challenging week in the fight against the #coronavirus it’s encouraging to see that more federal resources are headed to Louisiana. My thanks to @realDonaldTrump & the @CDCgov for their continued support of our brave medical professionals. https://t.co/pBWr1L7yuE

During a health crisis of this magnitude it's critical our medical professionals have the resources they need to treat patients with COVID-19. That's why I wrote to HHS to expedite the disbursement of $100 billion in relief funding to health care facilities. https://t.co/WjiRH8EG0m
A great opportunity for airmen and families at #BarksdaleAFB to get information on the #coronavirus ⬇️ https://t.co/SPEBPIDlKq

(1/2) @realDonaldTrump warned this will be a "tough week" ahead and the @Surgeon_General said it will be "our Pearl Harbor moment" in the war against the #coronavirus. @LouisianaGov said Sunday that Louisiana could run out of ventilators by Thursday and ICU beds by the weekend.

A big win for our churches & religious institutions! Earlier this week I led a bipartisan letter to fed agencies to make clear that it was Congress' intent that houses of worship be given the same access to coronavirus aid as other nonprofits. Read more ➡️ https://t.co/AL7xbcgKfu https://t.co/4Aqp11AARA

I am very pleased to see the Interim Final Rule for the Paycheck Protection Program clarifies that it was Congress’ intent that churches and other religious entities have equal access to coronavirus relief funds. Read the final rule here: https://t.co/0uUao5WpsS.

STAY HOME RIGHT NOW FOR THE SAKE OF YOUR COMMUNITY.  @POTUS just emphasized the importance of continuing the govt guidelines to #StopTheSpread & cited La. as an example of why *We are leading the US in the COVID-19 death rate. This is a STATEWIDE problem* https://t.co/FMtMCeXOvk

🚨BREAKING NEWS 🚨 In response to outreach from myself  @RepRichmond @SteveScalise & @WhipClyburn @USTreasury has taken steps to ensure that churches have equal access to coronavirus relief funds just as Congress intended. Hear more in my latest interview with Todd Starnes ⬇️ https://t.co/vXEYWAsvuE

Working w/ @RepRichmond @SteveScalise & @WhipClyburn to make clear that it was & is Congress' intent that houses of worship be given the same access to coronavirus aid as other nonprofits. Our churches shouldn't be left behind during these difficult times https://t.co/AL7xbcgKfu https://t.co/l9AsXQLLmZ

We don't often agree on policy but I love my good friend and former colleague State Rep. @EdwardTedJames. We're praying for Ted and all the other victims of COVID-19. Please heed his wise counsel on this. https://t.co/fXO0BXFxfO

On this National Day of Prayer please join us in praying for those who have been affected by the coronavirus and the countless heroes working around the clock here and abroad to keep the people safe.

My thanks to @LSUfootball's Coach O for doing his part to keep Louisianians healthy & safe as we all tackle the #coronavirus together. Let's all be team players and follow his game plan:  ✅Cover your cough w/ your elbow ✅Wash your hands ✅If you're sick stay home  #GeauxTigers https://t.co/0O1oK7m1Qj

I voted yes on the #coronavirus relief bill because so many people in our state needed me to. It is far from perfect but it will help keep Louisianians healthy & safe and minimize the disruption caused by the coronavirus.  My full statement ⬇️ https://t.co/3XK7hFZES3

(9/15) Because worship services are the places where we assemble embrace & share communion & where it is common for older Americans to gather wisdom suggests we should be careful to protect our people. Louisiana is currently listed in the top 10 states most affected by COVID-19

(1/15) I've received a number of calls from pastors & constituents around the LA-04 today inquiring about the wisdom & enforceability of the governor's coronavirus proclamation-which among other things limits gatherings of 250+ people from now until 4/13 (the day after Easter). https://t.co/zSFjJ4i8Kk

I've said from the start of the #coronavirus crisis my top priority is ensuring Louisianians have the resources they need to stay healthy & safe. The innovative forward-thinking public-private partnership announced by @realDonaldTrump will go a long way toward achieving that.

Recessing the House while health officials express concerns about limited resources is unjustifiable. The Senate @POTUS & - most importantly - the American people are waiting on the House to act on a #coronavirus funding package. We ought to keep working until the job is done. https://t.co/IOgGAlPPUW

.@VP Pence is a decisive organized and experienced leader. There is no one in the government better positioned secure the talent manpower and resources necessary to respond to the threat posed by coronavirus. He needs our support and our prayers. This is no time for politics
Politicize coronavirus? @SenWarren has a plan for that #shameful https://t.co/gc1jMQU8Co

With new #coronavirus cases being confirmed every day this is not a time to play politics. We’re a resilient people but we are stronger together. It’s my sincere hope that Congress will put partisanship aside to work with @realDonaldTrump to keep our communities healthy & safe.
